entry.definition: Internal stress of the unit cell.

description.h:div:
Stress is specified as a 3x3 matrix, by definition symmetric; it is laid out in the form: xx xy xz xy yy yz xz yz zz given axes x y z. 'Internal stress', in this context, could be either internally generated or externally applied; it is most commonly encountered in the context of minimization of energy of the system with variable lattice parameters at fixed external pressure.
Note that in Golem terms this is *not* a symmetric matrix, in that it is specified in full as 3x3 - not as the upper diagonal.

description.h:div: It should be noted that total energies in DFT calculations are relative rather than absolute, and thus as such have no intrinsic meaning in and of themselves; rather, they only have meaning when considered in comparison to atomically-equivalent systems calculated at the same precision (plane-wave cutoff, k-grid, etcetera).

entry.term: Partial density of states: calculate weights
INTERNAL ENTRY for golem web tool use

entry.definition: Concept which only occurs once in a document

description.h:p: Absolutely-positioned concepts occur exactly once in a document, and therefore do not need to be located by specifying a given grouping concept (or chain of grouping concepts).

entry.definition: Concept which may occur many times in a document

description.h:p: Relatively-positioned concepts can occur more than once in a document, and therefore need to be located by specifying a given grouping concept (or chain of grouping concepts).

entry.definition: Concept acting as a container for other concepts

description.h:p: Grouping concepts do not directly contain values; instead, they contain other, relatively positioned, concepts, which themselves may or may not contain values.

entry.definition: Concept with a direct payload of data

description.h:p: Value-bearing concepts directly contain observables - data with a value we can extract and evaluate.

entry.definition: User-specified input parameters for the simulation.
User-specified input parameters with defined transforms to code-native input.
A concept appearing the final properties of a task.

entry.definition: Pressure, as inputted in the portal: a single isotropic pressure applied to the entire system

entry.term: Input lattice parameters, as a b c alpha beta gamma

entry.definition: Space group of the inputted structure.
entry.description: Space group of the inputted structure. This will be used to either expand the unit cell into the P1 setting (for codes which do not deal with unit cell expansion) and/or to construct symmetry constraints for the simulation; in the case of CASTEP, we construct the P1 cell and find the relevant symmetry matrices.
Type of pseudopotentials (norm-conserving, ultrasoft, or on-the-fly) to be used in this calculation.
